full_text: Validation is a check executed by PolicyCenter before a given action, to ensure that the current business data is valid. Let's create a new contact. Select Person as the contact type. Validation with field validators will verify the field as the user types values. For example, the date field uses a field validator to ensure a certain format. The input mask appears as a watermark in the field and restricts user input, which must match the pattern. Letters or numbers entered using an incorrect format will not be accepted by the application. The input must match the pattern of the watermark. Validation occurs during save using business logic. Required fields have red asterisks on the UI. Error or warning messages are displayed on the UI after clicking Update. Next, let's look at how validation executed on wizard steps validates the policy data. For example, the user tries to navigate away from the page, when no driver is entered for the vehicle on a personal auto submission. A warning message is displayed. User can continue with other actions when a warning occurs. A warning or error message can be configured to be displayed at different point of time in a job. In this example, the driver missing on a vehicle is only a warning before quote, but it becomes an error when the quote button is clicked. The error or warning messages may be displayed on the top of the page, or in a worksheet at the bottom, depending on the validation method used. If the error message is displayed on a different page, there is a link to the page, where the condition exists. In this case, the error message is displayed on the Covertures page, but the error condition is on the Vehicles page. You can click on the error message. Clicking the link takes you to the Vehicles page, so that you can fix the problem. You can click the Clear button to get rid of the frame at the bottom. Try to quote again on the Vehicles page, where the problem exists. The error message is displayed again, but there is no link on the message, because it is on the same page. Errors must be resolved before the user can continue. This is the end of demonstration for validation-based

segments.text: Validation is a check executed by PolicyCenter before a given action, to ensure that the current business data is valid. Let's create a new contact.
Select Person as the contact type.
Validation with field validators will verify the field as the user types values. For example, the date field uses a field validator to ensure a certain format.
The input mask appears as a watermark in the field and restricts user input, which must match the pattern.
Letters or numbers entered using an incorrect format will not be accepted by the application. The input must match the pattern of the watermark.
Validation occurs during save using business logic. Required fields have red asterisks on the UI.
Error or warning messages are displayed on the UI after clicking Update.
Next, let's look at how validation executed on wizard steps validates the policy data.
For example, the user tries to navigate away from the page, when no driver is entered for the vehicle on a personal auto submission.
A warning message is displayed. User can continue with other actions when a warning occurs.

A warning or error message can be configured to be displayed at different point of time in a job. In this example, the driver missing on a vehicle is only a warning before quote, but it becomes an error when the quote button is clicked.
The error or warning messages may be displayed on the top of the page, or in a worksheet at the bottom, depending on the validation method used.
If the error message is displayed on a different page, there is a link to the page, where the condition exists.
In this case, the error message is displayed on the Covertures page, but the error condition is on the Vehicles page.
You can click on the error message.
Clicking the link takes you to the Vehicles page, so that you can fix the problem.
You can click the Clear button to get rid of the frame at the bottom.
Try to quote again on the Vehicles page, where the problem exists.
The error message is displayed again, but there is no link on the message, because it is on the same page.
Errors must be resolved before the user can continue.
This is the end of demonstration for validation-based
